question: Gas Exchange in Plants
answer: Stomata allows gases to go in and out of the leaf; Air spaces in the spongy mesophyll cells increase the SA and reduces the diffusion distance

question: How do stomata open and close
answer: Stomata open when turgid because the inside wall of the guard cells is thicker than the outside wall therefore the tugor pressure causes the cell to bend opening the stomata. Stomata close when flaccid as there is no tugor pressure to cause the guard cells to bend

question: What are xylem vessels made from
answer: Very long tube-like structures that are formed of dead cells with NO END WALLS

question: What is Transpiration
answer: When water evaporated from cells in the leaf into air spaces in the spongy mesophyll and leaves through the stomata

question: Process of the Transpiration Stream
answer: Transpiration occurs. This creates tension/suction which 'pulls' water into the leaf to replace the water lost. Water molecules are cohesive so the movement of one molecule cause the entire column of water to move up the xylem from the root where it enters the plant
